metadata.title: Unnecessary Features Installed - TFTP Client
metadata.description: TFTP Client feature is not installed

criterion.comment: Verifes TFTP Client feature is not installed

metadata.title: Unnecessary Features Installed - Telnet Client
metadata.description: Telnet Client feature is not installed

criterion.comment: Verifes Telnet Client feature is not installed

metadata.title: Lockout Duration
metadata.description: Lockout duration must meet minimum requirements.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Account lockout duration' is set to '0'
Verifies 'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'

metadata.title: Bad Logon Attempts
metadata.description: The number of allowed bad logon attempts must meet minimum requirements.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Account lockout threshold' is set to '3' or less
Verifies 'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'

metadata.title: Bad Logon Counter Reset
metadata.description: The time before the bad-logon counter is reset must meet minimum requirements.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Reset account lockout counter after' is set to at least '60' minutes
Verifies 'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'

metadata.title: Password Uniqueness
metadata.description: Password uniqueness must meet minimum requirements.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Enforce password history' is set to '24' passwords or more

metadata.title: Maximum Password Age
metadata.description: Maximum password age must meet minimum requirements.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Maximum Password Age' is set to '60' days or less
Verifies 'Maximum Password Age' is not set to '0'

metadata.title: Minimum Password Age
metadata.description: The minimum password age must meet requirements.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Minimum Password Age' is set to at least '1' day

metadata.title: Minimum Password Length
metadata.description: Passwords must, at a minimum, be 14 characters.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Minimum password length' is set to at least '14' characters

metadata.title: Microsoft Strong Password Filtering
metadata.description: The built-in Microsoft password complexity filter must be enabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Password must meet complexity requirements' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Reversible Password Encryption
metadata.description: Reversible password encryption must be disabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Store password using reversible encryption' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Direct Access - Route Through Internal Network
metadata.description: All Direct Access traffic must be routed through the internal network.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Route all traffic through the internal network' is set to 'Enabled: Enabled State'

metadata.title: WN08-CC-000015
metadata.description: Connections to non-domain networks when connected to a domain authenticated network must be blocked.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Prohibit connection to non-domain networks when connected to domain authenticated network' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: HTTP Printer Drivers
metadata.description: Downloading print driver packages over HTTP must be prevented.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Turn off downloading of print drivers over HTTP' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Internet Download / Online Ordering
metadata.description: Web publishing and online ordering wizards must be prevented from downloading a list of providers.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Turn off Internet download for Web publishing and online ordering wizards' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Printing Over HTTP
metadata.description: Printing over HTTP must be prevented.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Turn off printing over HTTP' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: WN08-CC-000053
metadata.description: Signing in using a PIN must be turned off.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Turn on PIN sign-in' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Power Mgmt - Password Wake on Battery
metadata.description: Users must be prompted for a password on resume from sleep (on battery).

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Require a password when a computer wakes (on battery)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Power Mgmt - Password Wake When Plugged In
metadata.description: The user must be prompted for a password on resume from sleep (plugged in).

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Require a password when a computer wakes (plugged in)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: RPC - Endpoint Mapper Authentication
metadata.description: Client computers must be required to authenticate for RPC communication.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Enable RPC Endpoint Mapper Client Authentication' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: RPC - Unauthenticated RPC Clients
metadata.description: Unauthenticated RPC clients must be restricted from connecting to the RPC server.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Restrict Unauthenticated RPC clients' is set to 'Enabled' and 'Authenticated'

metadata.title: Application Compatibility Program Inventory
metadata.description: The Application Compatibility Program Inventory must be prevented from collecting data and sending the information to Microsoft.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Turn off Inventory Collector' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Autoplay for non-volume devices
metadata.description: Autoplay must be turned off for non-volume devices.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Disallow Autoplay for non-volume devices' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Default Autorun Behavior
metadata.description: The default autorun behavior must be configured to prevent autorun commands.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Default behavior for AutoRun' is set to 'Enabled:Do not execute any autorun commands'

metadata.title: Disable Media Autoplay
metadata.description: Autoplay must be disabled for all drives.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Turn off AutoPlay' is set to 'Enabled:All Drives'

metadata.title: Enumerate Administrator Accounts on Elevation
metadata.description: The system must require username and password to elevate a running application.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Enumerate administrator accounts on elevation' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: WINCC-000078
metadata.description: The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit (EMET) system-wide Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) must be enabled and configured to Application Opt In.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'System ASLR' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Application Opt In' selected

metadata.title: WINCC-000079
metadata.description: The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit (EMET) Default Protections for Internet Explorer must be enabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Default Protections for Internet Explorer' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: WINCC-000082
metadata.description: The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit (EMET) system-wide Data Execution Prevention (DEP) must be enabled and configured to at least Application Opt Out.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'System DEP' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Application Opt Out' selected
Verifies 'System DEP' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Always On' selected

metadata.title: WINCC-000083
metadata.description: The Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit (EMET) system-wide Structured Exception Handler Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) must be configured to Application Opt Out.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'System SEHOP' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Application Opt Out' selected

metadata.title: Maximum Log Size - Application
metadata.description: The Application event log must be configured to a minimum size requirement.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Specify the maximum log size (KB)' is set at a minimum to 'Enabled:32768'

metadata.title: Maximum Log Size - Security
metadata.description: The Security event log must be configured to a minimum size requirement.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Specify the maximum log size (KB)' is set at a minimum to 'Enabled:81920'

metadata.title: Maximum Log Size - System
metadata.description: The System event log must be configured to a minimum size requirement.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Specify the maximum log size (KB)' is set at a minimum to 'Enabled:32768'

metadata.title: Windows Explorer - Heap Termination
metadata.description: Turning off File Explorer heap termination on corruption must be disabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Turn off heap termination on corruption' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Prevent Password Saving
metadata.description: Passwords must not be saved in the Remote Desktop Client.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Do not allow passwords to be saved' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Drive Redirection
metadata.description: Local drives must be prevented from sharing with Remote Desktop Session Hosts.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Do not allow drive redirection' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Password Prompting
metadata.description: Remote Desktop Services must always prompt a client for passwords upon connection.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Always prompt for password upon connection' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Set Encryption Level
metadata.description: Remote Desktop Services must be configured with the client connection encryption set to the required level.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Set client connection encryption level' is set to 'Enabled' and 'High Level'

metadata.title: RSS Attachment Downloads
metadata.description: Attachments must be prevented from being downloaded from RSS feeds.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Prevent downloading of enclosures' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Search - Encrypted Files Indexing
metadata.description: Indexing of encrypted files must be turned off.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Allow indexing of encrypted files' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Windows Installer - User Control
metadata.description: Users must be prevented from changing installation options.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Enable user control over installs' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Always Install with Elevated Privileges Disabled
metadata.description: The Windows Installer Always install with elevated privileges must be disabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Always install with elevated privileges' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: WINCC-000123
metadata.description: The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) client must not use Basic authentication.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Allow Basic authentication' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: WINCC-000124
metadata.description: The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) client must not allow unencrypted traffic.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Allow unencrypted traffic' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: WINCC-000125
metadata.description: The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) client must not use Digest authentication.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Disallow Digest authentication' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: WINCC-000126
metadata.description: The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) service must not use Basic authentication.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Allow Basic authentication' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: WINCC-000127
metadata.description: The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) service must not allow unencrypted traffic.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Allow unencrypted traffic' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: WINCC-000128
metadata.description: The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) service must not store RunAs credentials.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Disallow WinRM from storing RunAs credentials' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: TS/RDS - Secure RPC Connection
metadata.description: The Remote Desktop Session Host must require secure RPC communications.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Require secure RPC communication' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Limit Blank Passwords
metadata.description: Local accounts with blank passwords must be restricted to prevent access from the network.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Accounts: Limit local account use of blank passwords to console logon only' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Audit Policy Subcategory Setting
metadata.description: Audit policy using subcategories must be enabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings (Windows Vista or later) to override audit policy category settings' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Encrypting and Signing of Secure Channel Traffic
metadata.description: Outgoing secure channel traffic must be encrypted or signed.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Encryption of Secure Channel Traffic
metadata.description: Outgoing secure channel traffic must be encrypted when possible.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Domain member: Digitally encrypt secure channel data (when possible)' is set to 'Enabled'
Verifies 'Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Signing of Secure Channel Traffic
metadata.description: Outgoing secure channel traffic must be signed when possible.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Domain member: Digitally sign secure channel data (when possible)' is set to 'Enabled'
Verifies 'Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Computer Account Password Reset
metadata.description: The computer account password must not be prevented from being reset.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Domain member: Disable machine account password changes' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Maximum Machine Account Password Age
metadata.description: The maximum age for machine account passwords must be set to requirements.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Domain member: Maximum machine account password age' is set to '30' days or less
Verifies 'Domain member: Maximum machine account password age' is not set to '0'

metadata.title: Strong Session Key
metadata.description: The system must be configured to require a strong session key.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Domain member: Require strong (Windows 2000 or later) session key' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Domain Controller authentication for unlock
metadata.description: Domain Controller authentication must not be required to unlock the workstation.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Interactive logon: Require Domain Controller authentication to unlock workstation' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Smart Card Removal Option
metadata.description: The Smart Card removal option must be configured to Force Logoff or Lock Workstation.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Interactive logon: Smart card removal behavior' is set to 'Lock Workstation'
Verifies 'Interactive logon: Smart card removal behavior' is set to 'Force Logoff'

metadata.title: SMB Client Packet Signing (Always)
metadata.description: The Windows SMB client must be configured to always perform SMB packet signing.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Microsoft Network Client: Digitally sign communications (always)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: SMB Client Packet Signing (if server agrees)
metadata.description: The Windows SMB client must be enabled to perform SMB packet signing when possible.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (if server agrees)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Unencrypted Password is Sent to SMB Server
metadata.description: Unencrypted passwords must not be sent to a third-party SMB Server.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Microsoft Network Client: Send unencrypted password to connect to third-party SMB servers' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Idle Time Before Suspending a Session.
metadata.description: The amount of idle time required before suspending a session must be properly set.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Microsoft network server: Amount of idle time required before suspending session' is set to '15' minutes or less

metadata.title: SMB Server Packet Signing (Always)
metadata.description: The Windows SMB server must be configured to always perform SMB packet signing.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (always)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: SMB Server Packet Signing (if client agrees)
metadata.description: The Windows SMB server must perform SMB packet signing when possible.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (if client agrees)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Forcibly Disconnect when Logon Hours Expire
metadata.description: Users must be forcibly disconnected when their logon hours expire.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Microsoft network server: Disconnect clients when logon hours expire' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: SPN Target Name Validation Level
metadata.description: The service principal name (SPN) target name validation level must be configured to Accept if provided by client.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Microsoft network server: Server SPN target name validation level' is set to 'Accept if provided by client'

metadata.title: IPv6 Source Routing
metadata.description: IPv6 source routing must be configured to the highest protection level.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting IPv6) IP source routing protection level (protects against packet spoofing)' is set to 'Highest protection, source routing is completely disabled'

metadata.title: Disable IP Source Routing
metadata.description: The system must be configured to prevent IP source routing.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting) IP source routing protection level (protects against packet spoofing)' is set to 'Highest protection, source routing is completely disabled'

metadata.title: Disable ICMP Redirect
metadata.description: The system must be configured to prevent ICMP redirects from overriding OSPF generated routes.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (EnableICMPRedirect) Allow ICMP redirects to override OSPF generated routes' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Name-Release Attacks
metadata.description: The system must be configured to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'MSS: (NoNameReleaseOnDemand) Allow computer to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Restrict Anonymous SAM Enumeration
metadata.description: Anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts must not be allowed.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Restrict Anonymous Network Shares
metadata.description: Anonymous enumeration of shares must be restricted.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts and shares' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Storage of Passwords and Credentials
metadata.description: The system must be configured to prevent the storage of passwords and credentials.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Do not allow storage of credentials or .NET Passports for network authentication' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Everyone Anonymous Rights
metadata.description: The system must not be configured to give anonymous users Everyone rights.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Let Everyone permissions apply to anonymous users' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Anonymous Access to Named Pipes and Shares
metadata.description: Anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares must be restricted.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Restrict anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Sharing and Security Model for Local Accounts
metadata.description: The system must be configured to use the Classic security model.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network access: Sharing and security model for local accounts' is set to 'Classic - local users authenticate as themselves'

metadata.title: Computer Identity Authentication for NTLM
metadata.description: Services using Local System that use negotiate when reverting to NTLM authentication must use the computer identity vs. authenticating anonymously.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network Security: Allow Local System to use computer identity for NTLM' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: NTLM NULL Session Fallback
metadata.description: NTLM must be prevented from falling back to a Null session.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network security: Allow LocalSystem NULL session fallback' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: PKU2U Online Identities Authentication
metadata.description: PKU2U authentication using online identities must be prevented.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network Security: Allow PKU2U authentication requests to this computer to use online identities' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Kerberos Encryption Types
metadata.description: Kerberos encryption types must be configured to prevent the use of DES and RC4 encryption suites.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network Security: Configure encryption types allowed for Kerberos' is set to 'Enabled' with 'AES128_HMAC_SHA1', 'AES256_HMAC_SHA1', 'Future encryption types'

metadata.title: LAN Manager Hash Value Stored
metadata.description: The system must be configured to prevent the storage of the LAN Manager hash of passwords.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network security: Do not store LAN Manager hash value on next password change' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Force Logoff When Logon Hours Expire
metadata.description: The system must be configured to force users to log off when their allowed logon hours expire.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network security: Force logoff when logon hours expire' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: LanMan Authentication Level
metadata.description: The LanMan authentication level must be set to send NTLMv2 response only, and to refuse LM and NTLM.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network security: LAN Manager authentication level' is set to 'Send NTLMv2 response only. Refuse LM & NTLM' (Level 5)

metadata.title: LDAP Client Signing
metadata.description: Network Security: LDAP client signing requirements

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network security: LDAP client signing requirements' is set to at a minimum 'Negotiate signing'

metadata.title: Session Security for NTLM SSP Based Clients
metadata.description: The system must be configured to meet the minimum session security requirement for NTLM SSP based clients.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) clients' is set to 'Require NTLMv2 session security'
Verifies 'Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) clients' is set to 'Require 128-bit encryption'

metadata.title: Session Security for NTLM SSP Based Servers
metadata.description: The system must be configured to meet the minimum session security requirement for NTLM SSP based servers.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers' is set to 'Require NTLMv2 session security'
Verifies 'Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers' is set to 'Require 128-bit encryption'

metadata.title: Recovery Console - Automatic Logon
metadata.description: The Recovery Console option must be set to prevent automatic logon to the system.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Recovery console: Allow automatic administrative logon' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: FIPS Compliant Algorithms
metadata.description: The system must be configured to use FIPS-compliant algorithms for encryption, hashing, and signing.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'System cryptography: Use FIPS compliant algorithms for encryption, hashing, and signing' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Case Insensitivity for Non-Windows
metadata.description: The system must be configured to require case insensitivity for non-Windows subsystems.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'System objects: Require case insensitivity for non-Windows subsystems' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: Global System Objects Permission Strength
metadata.description: The default permissions of global system objects must be increased.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'System objects: Strengthen default permissions of internal system objects (e.g. Symbolic Links)' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: UAC - Admin Approval Mode
metadata.description: User Account Control approval mode for the built-in Administrator must be enabled.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'User Account Control: Admin Approval Mode for the Built-in Administrator account' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: UAC - Admin Elevation Prompt
metadata.description: User Account Control must, at minimum, prompt administrators for consent on the secure desktop.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode' is set to 'Prompt for consent on the secure desktop'
Verifies 'User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode' is set to 'Prompt for credentials on the secure desktop'

metadata.title: UAC - Application Installations
metadata.description: User Account Control must be configured to detect application installations and prompt for elevation.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'User Account Control: Detect application installations and prompt for elevation' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: UAC - UIAccess Application Elevation
metadata.description: User Account Control must only elevate UIAccess applications that are installed in secure locations.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'User Account Control: Only elevate UIAccess applications that are installed in secure locations' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: UAC - All Admin Approval Mode
metadata.description: User Account Control must run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode, enabling UAC.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'User Account Control: Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: UAC - Non UAC Compliant Application Virtualization
metadata.description: User Account Control must virtualize file and registry write failures to per-user locations.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'User Account Control: Virtualize file and registry write failures to per-user locations' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: UR: Act as part of the operating system
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Act as part of the operating system user right.

criterion.comment: Act as part of the operating system - None

metadata.title: UR: Create a token object
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Create a token object user right.

criterion.comment: Create a token object - None

metadata.title: UR: Create permanent shared objects
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Create permanent shared objects user right.

criterion.comment: Create permanent shared objects - None

metadata.title: UR: Debug Programs
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Debug programs user right.

criterion.comment: Debug Programs - Administrators

metadata.title: UR: Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation user right.

criterion.comment: Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation - None

metadata.title: UR: Lock pages in memory
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Lock pages in memory user right.

criterion.comment: Lock pages in memory - None

metadata.title: UR: Modify an object label
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Modify an object label user right.

criterion.comment: Modify an object label - None

metadata.title: UR: Replace a process level token
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Replace a process level token user right.

criterion.comment: Replace a process level token - Local Service, Network Service

metadata.title: Group Policy - Do Not Turn off Background Refresh
metadata.description: Group Policies must be refreshed in the background if the user is logged on.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Turn Off Background Refresh of Group Policy' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: WINSO-000021
metadata.description: The machine inactivity limit must be set to 15 minutes, locking the system with the screensaver.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Interactive logon: Machine inactivity limit' is set to '900' seconds or less

metadata.title: UR: Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller user right.

criterion.comment: Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller - None

metadata.title: Legal Notice Display
metadata.description: The required legal notice must be configured to display before console logon.

criterion.comment: Legal Notice is configured with the required text.
Legal Notice is configured with the required text.

metadata.title: Legal Banner Dialog Box Title
metadata.description: The Windows dialog box title for the legal banner must be configured.

criterion.comment: Legal Notice Caption - DoD Notice and Consent Banner
Legal Notice Caption - US Department of Defense Warning Statement

metadata.title: UR: Access this computer from the network
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Access this computer from the network user right.

criterion.comment: Access this computer from the network - Administrators

metadata.title: UR: Adjust memory quotas for a process
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Adjust memory quotas for a process user right.

criterion.comment: Adjust memory quotas for a process - Administrators, Local Service, Network Service

metadata.title: UR: Allow log on locally
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Allow log on locally user right.

criterion.comment: Allow log on locally - Administrators, Users

metadata.title: UR: Back up files and directories
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Back up files and directories user right.

criterion.comment: Back up files and directories - Administrators

metadata.title: UR: Change the system time
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Change the system time user right.

criterion.comment: Change the system time - Administrators, Local Service

metadata.title: UR: Create a pagefile
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Create a pagefile user right.

criterion.comment: Create a pagefile - Administrators

metadata.title: UR: Create global objects
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Create global objects user right.

criterion.comment: Create global objects - Administrators, Service, Local Service, Network Service

metadata.title: UR: Create symbolic links
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Create symbolic links user right.

criterion.comment: Create symbolic links - Administrators

metadata.title: UR: Force shutdown from a remote system
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Force shutdown from a remote system user right.

criterion.comment: Force shutdown from a remote system - Administrators

metadata.title: UR: Generate security audits
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Generate security audits user right.

criterion.comment: Generate security audits - Local Service, Network Service

metadata.title: UR: Impersonate a client after authentication
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Impersonate a client after authentication user right.

criterion.comment: Impersonate a client after authentication - Administrators, Service, Local Service, Network Service

metadata.title: UR: Increase scheduling priority
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Increase scheduling priority user right.

criterion.comment: Increase scheduling priority - Administrators

metadata.title: UR: Load and unload device drivers
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Load and unload device drivers user right.

criterion.comment: Load and unload device drivers - Administrators

metadata.title: UR: Manage auditing and security log
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Manage auditing and security log user right.

criterion.comment: Manage auditing and security log - Administrators

metadata.title: UR: Modify firmware environment values
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Modify firmware environment values user right.

criterion.comment: Modify firmware environment values - Administrators

metadata.title: UR: Perform volume maintenance tasks
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Perform volume maintenance tasks user right.

criterion.comment: Perform volume maintenance tasks - Administrators

metadata.title: UR: Profile single process
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Profile single process user right.

criterion.comment: Profile single process - Administrators

metadata.title: UR: Restore files and directories
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Restore files and directories user right.

criterion.comment: Restore files and directories - Administrators

metadata.title: UR: Take ownership of files or other objects
metadata.description: Unauthorized accounts must not have the Take ownership of files or other objects user right.

metadata.title: WINPK-000001 DoD Root Certificate
metadata.description: The DoD Root Certificate must be installed into the Trusted Root Store.

criterion.comment: Verifies the DoD Root Certificate is installed into the Trusted Root Store
Verifies the DoD Root Certificate is installed into the Trusted Root Store
Verifies the DoD Root Certificate is installed into the Trusted Root Store
Verifies the DoD Root Certificate is installed into the Trusted Root Store

metadata.title: WINPK-000002 External CA Root Certificate
metadata.description: The External CA Root Certificate must be installed into the Trusted Root Store.

metadata.title: WINER-000005
metadata.description: Multiple error reports of the same error type are useful in diagnosing potential system configuration issues, as well as intrusion activity. This setting controls whether error reporting collects additional, second-level report data even if a CAB file containing data about the event types has already been collected.

criterion.comment: config error reporting enabled with do not collect files unchecked

metadata.title: WINER-000006
metadata.description: Displaying error messages to users provides them the option of sending the reports. Error reports should be sent silently, unknown to the user. This setting controls whether users are shown an error dialog box that lets them report an error.

criterion.comment: DontShowUI enabled

metadata.title: WINER-000012
metadata.description: The retention of archived reports provides a history. Older reports are automatically deleted as new reports are generated once the maximum limit has been met. The archive is stored locally on the system and is created after the error report has been sent to the local collector or DOD-wide collector (if defined).

criterion.comment: MaxArchiveCount 100 or greater

metadata.title: WINER-000013
metadata.description: Queueing error reports provides the ability for a system to collect reports locally or until a collection server can be contacted. Valuable system diagnostic and vulnerability information may be lost if the report queue is disabled.

criterion.comment: DisableQueue enabled

metadata.title: WINER-000014
metadata.description: Error reports are queued for sending to an error reporting site when the queueing behavior is set to Always Queue. This will maintain the reports in the queue until a connection can be made to the collection server.

criterion.comment: ForceQueue enabled

metadata.title: WINER-000015
metadata.description: The error reporting queue is stored locally on the system and contains the error reports until they have been manually removed or automatically sent to the local collector or DOD-wide collector (if defined). Once a report has been sent to a collector, it is moved to the report archive. Old reports are deleted as new ones arrive once the maximum limit has been met.

criterion.comment: MaxQueueCount 50 or greater

metadata.title: WINER-000016
metadata.description: Error reports stored in the queue should be forwarded to a local or DOD-wide collection site when the system can connect to the site. This setting controls the frequency a system will use to try forwarding queued reports to the local or DOD-wide collector.

criterion.comment: QueuePesterInterval enabled

metadata.title: WINER-000017
metadata.description: Configuring error reporting to send all requested data ensures all relevant data associated with the error report is captured for later analysis. This setting determines the default consent behavior of Windows Error Reporting.

criterion.comment: DefaultConsent enabled

metadata.title: WINER-000018
metadata.description: This setting determines the behavior of the "Configure Default Consent" setting in relation to custom consent settings. Enabling this allows the default consent levels of Windows Error Reporting to always override any other consent policy setting.

criterion.comment: DefaultOverrideBehavior enabled

metadata.title: The Windows Error Reporting Service must be running and configured to start automatically.
metadata.description: Windows Error Reporting information can be used to help diagnose day-to-day software issues, as well as help discover malicious code and possibly zero-day attacks on systems.

criterion.comment: verifies WER service is running
verifies WER start type is auto

metadata.title: Permissions for the Application event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.
metadata.description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The Application event log may be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.

criterion.comment: The Applicaion event log must have at least default permissions. Strict Path
The Application event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.
The Applicaion event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path
The Application event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.

metadata.title: Permissions for the Security event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.
metadata.description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The Security event log may disclose sensitive information or be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.

criterion.comment: The Security event log must have at least default permissions. Strict Path
The Security event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.
The Security event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path
The Security event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.

metadata.title: Permissions for the System event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.
metadata.description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The System event log may be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.

criterion.comment: The System event log must have at least default permissions. Strict Path
The System event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.
The System event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path
The System event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.

metadata.title: Early Launch Antimalware, Boot-Start Driver Initialization Policy must prevent boot drivers identified as bad.
metadata.description: Compromised boot drivers can introduce malware prior to protection mechanisms that load after initialization. The Early Launch Antimalware driver can limit allowed drivers based on classifications determined by the malware protection application. At a minimum, drivers determined to be bad must not be allowed.

criterion.comment: 'Boot-Start Driver Initialization Policy' is not set to All, ~7~.

metadata.title: Group Policy objects must be reprocessed even if they have not changed.
metadata.description: Enabling this setting and then selecting the "Process even if the Group Policy objects have not changed" option ensures that the policies will be reprocessed even if none have been changed. This way, any unauthorized changes are forced to match the domain-based group policy settings again.

criterion.comment: NoGPOistChanges is set to 0.

metadata.title: The Windows SmartScreen must be configured to require approval from an administrator before running downloaded unknown software.
metadata.description: Windows SmartScreen helps protect systems from programs downloaded from the internet that may be malicious. Requiring administrator approval before running unknown software will prevent users from executing potentially malicious programs.

metadata.title: Basic authentication for RSS feeds over HTTP must not be used.

metadata.title: WN08-CC-000050
metadata.description: Connected users on domain-joined computers must not be enumerated.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Do not enumerate connected users on domain-joined computers' is set to 'Enabled'

metadata.title: WN10-CC-000130
metadata.description: Local users on domain-joined computers must not be enumerated.

criterion.comment: Verifies 'Enumerate local users on domain-joined computers' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Unsupported Service Packs
metadata.description: Systems must be maintained at a supported service pack level.

Verifies the OS Build is equal to or greater than 10586

metadata.title: Disable Automatic Logon
metadata.description: Automatic logons must be disabled.

criterion.comment: 'MSS: (AutoAdminLogon) Enable Automatic Logon (not recommended)' is set to 'Disabled'

metadata.title: Users must be notified if a web-based program attempts to install software.
metadata.description: Web-based programs may attempt to install malicious software on a system. Ensuring users are notified if a web-based program attempts to install software allows them to refuse the installation.

criterion.comment: 'SafeForScripting' is set to 'Disabled' or 'Not Configured'

metadata.title: Caching of logon credentials must be limited.
metadata.description: The default Windows configuration caches the last logon credentials for users who log on interactively to a system. This feature is provided for system availability reasons, such as the user's machine being disconnected from the network or domain controllers being unavailable. Even though the credential cache is well-protected, if a system is attacked, an unauthorized individual may isolate the password to a domain user account using a password-cracking program and gain access to the domain.

metadata.title: User Account Control must automatically deny elevation requests for standard users.
metadata.description: User Account Control (UAC) is a security mechanism for limiting the elevation of privileges, including administrative accounts, unless authorized. Denying elevation requests from standard user accounts requires tasks that need elevation to be initiated by accounts with administrative privileges. This ensures correct accounts are used on the system for privileged tasks to help mitigate credential theft.
